entry.title: Ukraine Readies Plans to Evacuate Civilians Amid Fighting Near Nuclear Plant
entry.content: Russia has rejected demands to withdraw troops from the Zaporizhzhia facility, where Ukraine says Moscow risks causing a global tragedy.

entry.title: Why the U.S. Never Caught Mullah Omar
entry.content: The Taliban’s late founder hid out for years in Afghan homes while the U.S. hunted for him in Pakistan. The new Kabul regime is eager to celebrate his mystique and legacy,

entry.title: The New Neighbor Is Causing a Commotion. Oh, and He's the President of South Korea.
entry.content: The country’s new leader is moving the official office from the secluded ‘Blue House’ into central Seoul to be less remote. Now he’s too close for some citizens’ comfort.

entry.title: With Western Funds Slow to Arrive, Ukraine Scrapes to Pay Its Soldiers
entry.content: Kyiv is struggling with a yawning gap between the cost of the war and depressed tax revenues in an economy battered by Russia’s invasion.
